intro: Lisianthius rusbyanus, commonly known as the Rusby's lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madeira. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
